intro: Amaranthus scleranthoides f. typica, commonly known as the common amaranth, is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its upright growth habit and branched stems. It features lanceolate to ovate leaves that are usually hairy and have a reddish or purplish tinge. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green to reddish in color, followed by spiny, triangular seeds. It is native to the Americas but has been introduced to various regions around the world. This species is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
